intro: Bonamia abdita, commonly known as the rock wallaby bush, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces small, white or yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are usually simple, alternate, and have a rough or hairy texture. Bonamia abdita is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils.
